text:
Jensen Huang is basically saying custom chips from $GOOGL, $AMZN, $AMZN, $MSFT & $META struggle to compete with $NVDA because Nvidia is singularly focused on AI acceleration at a scale no one else matches.

CUDA is the default language developers build on, NVLink is still ahead when it comes to scaling GPUs together and Nvidia spends ~$20B a year with its entire org dedicated to making AI faster. 

The simple reality is Nvidia is all-in, all the time.

$GOOGL CEO Sundar Pichai said they don‚Äôt fully understand their own AI systems after models began doing things they weren‚Äôt explicitly programmed to do.

One model even taught itself a foreign language.

SpaceX just filed with the FCC to launch up to 1M satellites designed to function as solar-powered orbital data centers creating massive AI compute capacity in space.

Elon wants to use Starship‚Äôs low launch costs and laser-linked satellites to scale AI compute without stressing Earth‚Äôs power grid.

$ASML machines use extremely tiny light (~13.5 nanometers wide) to draw patterns on computer chips allowing chipmakers to create features thousands of times thinner than a human hair.

The smaller those patterns are, the more powerful and energy-efficient the chips become.

If you‚Äôre wondering why asset prices are getting hit like gold down over 10% and silver down more than 30% in a day then listen to this Kevin Warsh clip. 

He‚Äôs openly critical of QE and favors a tighter Fed balance sheet which means less liquidity across markets.

Jensen Huang said AI performance depends on both HBM & LPDDR highlighting just how critical memory is to $NVDA stack which is an obvious tailwind for suppliers like $MU.

He added that demand is still growing faster than supply across the chain.

Jensen Huang said $TSM will need to ‚Äúwork very hard‚Äù this year to meet $NVDA needs for wafers and CoWoS.

He added that demand remains very strong and that TSMC is doing an ‚Äúincredible job‚Äù ramping supply.

Waymo is finalizing a $16B raise at a ~$110B valuation with $GOOGL supplying over 75% of the capital alongside Sequoia Capital.

Sources say ARR is now $350M+ and the round was 3x oversubscribed.

$MSTR Bitcoin position has officially turned negative as $BTC slips below $76,000.

This is the first time Bitcoin has traded below Michael Saylor‚Äôs cost basis since October 2023.
BITCOIN $BTC JUST DROPPED BELOW $80,000

$ASML just raised EUV machine prices ~50% since last year to $284M per machine.

This is what true monopoly power looks like when demand explodes and customers have zero alternatives.

ASML is the only company on Earth that makes EUV lithography machines where $TSM + $INTC need them to produce the advanced nodes that power $NVDA + $AMD GPUs, $GOOGL TPUs and every other frontier AI accelerator.

$SOFI just posted its largest quarterly member growth ever by adding 1M new members in Q4.

The company is positioning itself as the full digital on-ramp where retail banking, investing and digital assets converge.

Stanley Druckenmiller said in 2023 that copper was ‚Äúthe tightest position I‚Äôve ever studied.‚Äù

The AI economy‚Äôs power buildout only tightens that further with every viable path running straight through copper.

Initiated a starter position in the growth port for copper exposure.

4/4

Today, it is silver-market stress (for now??). See the last few days of premium/discounts.

If silver "rights the ship" in the next few days, we live to fight another day.

If not, that "another day" might be now for the firms caught on the wrong side of this liquidity gap.

3/4

While -1.7% sounds small vs 19%, it is historically massive.

This is the deepest liquidity dislocation in $SLV since Aug 9, 2011‚Äîthe day after the US lost its AAA rating.

Discounts don't mean the ETF is broken. They signal the underlying market is under severe stress.

2/4

But the stress is still real.

The chart below recalculates SLV's "fair value" at 4 PM ET using spot prices to eliminate the timing lag.

When we do that, the "timing" 19% discount vanishes, revealing the real discount: -1.7%.

@dampedspring @EricBalchunas @SantiagoAuFund

1/4

The viral "19% discount" in $SLV is a timing artifact, not a broken product.

The Official NAV is based on the London Fix (~7 AM ET). This means the official price missed the entire afternoon crash in the US futures market.üßµ

To be clear, I said the "silver market is broken," not $SLV is broken.

ETFs always trade at premiums/discounts. That does not mean something is wrong with the ETF. Instead, extremes signal problems in the underlying market.

Like this chart, the biggest move in 75+ years.

$SLV saw volume than the most traded stocks on the planet last week, I still can't get over that. More than Tesla, more than Nvidia (chart). It's not even gold either, it's fricken silver. A month ago the volume was 10x less. A year ago it was the 170th biggest ETF, out of sight, out of mind. The only thing in recent memory that's felt similar is $GME and maybe $MSTR.

"Nah‚Ä¶ nothing is broken"

Just the biggest single-day decline in at least 75 years.

All is well, all is normal. Nothing to see here ... move along.

SLV's NAV was $95 on Friday. The closing price was $75 (the record 19% discount).

Silver can be unchanged on Monday (NAV stays at $95), and the price can be up $20 (or 27%) to close this premium/discount.

My guess is we SHOULD see massive degen/retail buying right on the open Sunday night, trying to take advantage of the massive discount.

If that does not happen, or the immediate bound fades into Monday, I would interpret that as a forced liquidation steamrolling the degens/retail. 

Forced liquidation is the result of a troubled firm being forced to sell due to margin calls and other immediate creditor demands, in a desperate attempt to stay solvent.

If the bounce holds, however, this market is "righting" itself, the premium/discount is closing, and everyone lives to die another day.

Yesterday's 19% discount to NAV broke the record set on 10/10/2008, the day the TARP was introduced during the Global Financial Crisis.

Before Friday's collapse, SLV had about $60 billion in assets.

The chart above shows that the silver market is now broken, meaning there is a high risk that a financial firm heavily involved in this market is either bankrupt (causing the large discount above) or in serious trouble (due to the large discount above).

It doesn't mean we will automatically see a firm fail, but the silver market needs to correct itself quickly; otherwise, it probably will.

Quickly correct itself = Monday or Tuesday.

Yes, we saw a marginally higher high in Oct 2025 ($126k), but it was a "zombie rally." 

It looked like a breakout, but it was just residual momentum. The smart money riding the institutional adoption wave had begun exiting in Dec 2024.

Stop chasing a ghost.

This was just a few days after the April 2nd "Liberation Day" collapse began, when markets were in full hyperventilation mode.

In my analysis hitting inboxes today, I examine what TSMC $TSM is signaling about the strength of the AI trade in commentary that offers multi-year visibility - which few companies in the AI ecosystem can match. Link in bio. 

$NVDA $AMD $AVGO

By 2027, TrendForce projects the memory market to rise another 53% YoY to $842.7 billion, again led by DRAM with growth of 65% YoY to $667 billion. 

This would represent approximately 7X growth in DRAM revenue from 2024‚Äôs $95.9 billion. 

$MU $AMD $NVDA $AVGO

Counterpoint Research estimates that cumulative AI ASICs shipments will reach 40 million at the top 10 hyperscalers from 2024 through 2028, with 15 million shipments in 2028.

$AVGO $GOOG $META $MSFT

AI spending can continue to grow, even as AI stock valuations compress.

That‚Äôs what happened with tech leaders after 2000: earnings grew, but multiples didn‚Äôt.

#DynamicWealthGroup

CapEx booms don‚Äôt always end when investment stops.

More often, stock prices peak years before spending does, as valuations adjust faster than real-world activity.
